experience: You and Christopher both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Ed Nusbaum, and 35 others

I am a software developer on Tanga's core XP technology team.   We work hard to map our software to the domain of our business using Domain Driven Design (DDD) and implemented in Ruby on Rails, PHP, and IOS.  We are constantly experimenting with Agile and XP methodologies in order to improve on the delivery and maintainability of code.  I focus on direct, empathetic, communication, constant collaboration and modular, object oriented software design to deliver value several times a day through a continuous integration workflow.

Succeeded in the goal of taking a software project from simple idea to revenue.  Championed the adoption of lean methodologies such as a protocol of transparency, and vetted standard operating procedures throughout the organization including technology, marketing, sales and customer service.  Facilitated  regular design and planning to establish the priority and delivery of value-focused features.* Full life-cycle management, engineering and delivery* Easy deployment and bootstrapping, continuous integration* Lead delivery platform, pricing models, online payments.
Ruby on Rails developer emphasizing software craftsmanship and empowered teams. We build sturdy, changeable software that will enable a revolution in the Health Care industry.
Scrum Master and Agile Software Developer

As a developer worked on teams with two to fourteen members to develop projects with scopes ranging from a few weeks to 4+ years. We focused on delivering small, tested, and deployable features on a weekly basis. As a Scrum Master, facilitated standup meetings, planning workshops, estimating, tasking, commitment, and retrospective meetings. Provided Coaching on Agile and XP best practices. Helped to maintain an adherence to peer reviewed standards in order to help maintain a productive, energized work environment.
Big Brothers Big Sisters of Central Arizona

Designed and implemented applications to provide better visibility into case management. Developed an intranet portal framework based on social networking standards to provide a well known paradigm to empower users to work with the large amount of collaboration required to manage their cases.

Team anchor on a project to develop Military training applications and provide heads-up real-time combat information to troops in battle.   We used off the shelf components to provide GPS information, remote camera operation, and command dissemination through the Army’s chain of command.  Represented the company and provided field support, training to be sure the prototypes were running well.

When I started at Integrum I was experienced with Ruby but not Ruby on Rails.  Chris was one of the various developers I pair programmed with while getting up to speed, and it was an enjoyable and intellectually challenging experience.  He put up with (and sometimes went along with) my strong opinions on Ruby best practices, yet stood his ground when he knew I was attempting something that wasn't in line with the Rails way or the Integrum way.  And he did it all in very amicable fashion.He's also dedicated to constant improvement of his own techniques and the health of the software development ecosystem.  In his spare time, he blogs about his experiences with customers and fellow developers, and how to get the two to see eye to eye and create successful products.  More than once his writings have made me stop and think and even change my habits.Chris is a strong developer with a genuine interest in his craft.  I would highly recommend him.
